changelogversion.changelogtext: [b]Improvement[/b] - Fixed the card size issue of the Artist tab and the Albums tab.
[b]New![/b] Album view now shows the artist for the songs.
[b]New![/b] Fast Scroll bar - expect bugs.
[b]New![/b] If there is no artist or album art, an icon is generated with the first letter and a random color from the material palette.
[b]New![/b] Album art loads in the Album view now!
Album View is practically finished, need to fix the Art loading in the Banner.
NavDrawer text is done, the only working fuction is the Changelog, which will eventually move to the Settings Page.
Artist Panel is almost done.
Planning on adding an Album list for the artist view.
[i]Improvement[/i] - Songs tab is now a recycler-view along with the rest of the tabs.
[b]New![/b] Now Playing panel shell is there. Access via the Snackbar from the main FAB.
[b]Todo:[/b] Fix the album art in the Album view([b]Done[/b]), implement Last.fm, and change the artists view art from a square to circle, and the default icon to a person.
[b]New![/b] Album view is implemented, along with album art, expect bugs.
[b]New![/b] NavDrawer, not nearly setup yet.
Music no longer plays, it will be re-implemented more efficiently in the near future.
Artist Panel only reacts with a toast.
[i]Improvement[/i] - Changed anything I could over to the new v22 support library, ex. the Tab Bars, the Nav Drawer, and the FAB's.
[b]New![/] Music can be played, but not paused or controlled. Stop it via the overflow menu.
Changed the looks of the tab panel.
FAB is on all tabs now.
Beginnings of album view is there.
[b]Todo:[/b] Each panel needs a scrollbar that can scroll through quickly alphabetically
[i]Improvement[/i] - Tab menu is custom now.
[i]Improvement[/i] - FAB stays on screen now.
[i]Improvement[/i] - Tabs underline is now white.
[b]New![/b] The artist page now has a FAB Toolbar as featured in the new Material Design Specs.
[b]New![/b] Added Ripple effect for what will hopefully be the animation for the Now Playing Panel.
[b]New![/b] Started tracking versions.
